profileAlternative.name: Anoush Najarian
profileAlternative.headline: Eng. Manager • Hiring a Deep Learning Perf Engineer • Speaker at GHC19, ODSC, WECode • NeurIPS Meetup Chair • CMG Board
profileAlternative.summary: Passionate about building things, business development, creating amazing software tools with world-class performance and scalability. Love learning new things and growing with my team. Love to play with maker toys: robots, circuits, 3D printing, VR - and with math and languages.

aboutAlternative.text: Passionate about building things, business development, creating amazing software tools with world-class performance and scalability. Love learning new things and growing with my team. Love to play with maker toys: robots, circuits, 3D printing, VR - and with math and languages.

positions.title: Software Engineering Manager, MATLAB Performance Team
positions.description: Love solving performance puzzles, helping my team grow and achieve professional goals, learning, teaching, and collaborating on amazing software tools for engineers and scientists

positions.title: Vice-Chair of the Board Of Directors
positions.description: Vice Chair of the Board of Directors of an international professional organization of Performance and Capacity Planning Engineers, CMG, Computer Measurement Group.

positions.title: Software Architect, Algorithm Authoring
positions.description:
Manager of a team of software developers and mathematicians working in a Scrum environment. Product Manager and Architect for Maple Authoring Environment, a Maple, PHP, and Java-based tool for authoring algorithmic questions for HM's online Math courses. Author of software requirements and design specifications. Technical Lead working in collaboration with HM Math Editorial, Media Production, vendors, and freelancers.
…
see more

positions.title: Software Engineer, Kernel Group; Performance Analyst
positions.description: Implemented the RIPv2 network protocol for VOS, Stratus’s proprietary OS. Developed Java Native Interface under VOS. Designed performance tests, measured hardware and software performance.

positions.title: Volunteer, Founder
positions.description: Founded a Linux lab for children in a community at the site of the 1988 Armenian Earthquake. Established a peer teaching network, coached a team of instructors. Together, we designed groundbreaking curricula in Computer Animation, Digital Newspaper Publishing, Digital Radio, and Software Development for ages 11-18.

positions.title: Guest Lecturer in Computer Networks
positions.description: Delivered a course in Computer Networks to graduating seniors at Armenia’s top Computer Science Department. Pioneered the use of online teaching materials at the Department.

positions.title: Teaching Assistant and Research Assistant
positions.description: Taught Mathematics for Educators, Discrete Math, Calculus I, II, III, Calculus and Mathematica, and Harvard Calculus (small-groups course using graphing calculators). Proof-read a monograph on Several Complex Variables. Implemented numerical algorithms using MATLAB.

given.text:
I know Nacer as an effective communicator, and a creative and tenacious problem-solver. Nacer helped my team work through a tricky customer case on performance. Nacer kept everyone informed, advocated for the customer effectively, and was relentless in investigating the issue: perusing customer artifacts; running a variety of MATLAB code; learning about and using profiling tools; learning how the operating system, drivers, and virtualization impact performance; running interactive sessions to guide the customer through the investigation. What we ultimately discovered was that the virtualized environment the customer was using was misconfigured. We received very enthusiastic feedback from the customer on this case! Nacer's work was instrumental in enlisting the customer as an advocate for our customer service, and our products.
…
See more

When I think about Jamey Frank, what stands out is Jamey's amazing productivity and professionalism. Projects we have worked on together owe their success to Jamey's mastery of Project Management, communication skills, and charisma. Jamey's background in math, graphic design, and technology have been indispensable at every turn.

William is an earnest and competent professional. His background in software development, radars and in math has proven exceedingly helpful. William has done an excellent job of learning how to use new tools and technologies (Java, Groovy, Perl, Selenium, Nunit, Maple) and software development processes, such as Scrum. I recommend him with confidence.
